content:
I'm really interested in exploring more films that delve into the theme of technology and humanity. I've seen a few of the films you mentioned, like Blade Runner and The Matrix, but I'd love to check out some of the others. Ex Machina and Her are particularly intriguing to me, as they seem to explore the emotional and psychological aspects of human relationships with technology. I'll definitely add those to my watchlist.

By the way, I've been thinking about the Chicago International Film Festival, and I was wondering if you knew of any other film festivals that focus on sci-fi and technology-themed films. I'd love to attend one of those in the future and explore more films that explore the intersection of technology and humanity.
assistant<|end_header_id|>

Ex Machina and Her are both thought-provoking films that explore the emotional and psychological aspects of human relationships with technology.
